inkball

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • inkball.GameObject
      • inkball.Tile

  • public class Tile
extends GameObject
    The Tile class represents each tile on the game board. Tiles can be walls, holes, or empty spaces and contain properties such as their type (wall, hole, or empty) and methods for interacting with other game objects (e.g., drawing and collision detection).

        Constructor for the Tile class
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the tile
        y - y coordinate of the tile
        type - type of the tile (WALL, HOLE or EMPTY)
        board - Reference to game board in which the tile is a part of

        public LineSegment[] getHitbox()
        Gets the hitbox for this tile (only applicable for wall tiles).

      • setDebugColour

        public void setDebugColour(int colour)

      • setTileType

        public void setTileType(Tile.TileType type)
        Sets the the type of the tile
        Parameters:
        type - The TileType of the tile (WALL, HOLE or EMPTY)

      • initialiseHitbox

        public void initialiseHitbox()
        Initializes the hitbox for wall tiles. The hitbox consists of the four edges of the tile, represented as line segments.

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet app)
        Draws the tile on the game board. The rendering depends on the type of tile (e.g., wall, hole, or empty) and the associated images or colors.
        Overrides:
        draw in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        app - The PApplet used to render the tile.
